post.summary: New - Import approved Android Enterprise apps to AirWatch
post.description: * Imports all the approved apps in admin Google account of the organization to AirWatch. This makes them available to be managed by AirWatch. Imported apps can be assigned to the smart groups to be made available to the users in the organization.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for the organization group(Required)

412.description: {7501: Android Enterprise is not enabled for this Organization Group}

patch.summary: New - Approve an app on admin Google account for the organization
patch.description: * Approves the input application on admin Google account for given organization group. This has the same effect of logging into Google Work PlayStore and approving a selected application for the organization. This does not add that application automatically to AirWatch. Call to 'import' API is needed for the same.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for the organization group(Required)

parameters.name: androidWorkAppSettingV1Model
parameters.description: JsonPatch containing operation type and the model. Only 'replace' operation is supported.(Required)

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: Unique Identifier for the Android application on Google PlayStore(Required)

400.description: 1. {7001: Please make sure the bundleId is valid.} 2. {6: Invalid Operation: update}

post.summary:
InstallApp(..) API will enable app install. It mimics the app catalog flow. Added for Greenbox integration.
This method supports install for different app types. It forwards requests to respective app type adapters.
It also covers the EULA and Compliance flows for app install.
post.description: v1

get.summary:
Search and retrieve removal logs for internal applications.
If the number of remove application commands queued in a set time interval is exceeded the commands are put in locked state
The API method returns the details of the commands that are put in locked state
The records returned take into consideration the filter criteria recieved in request query

put.summary:
Updates the action taken on the threshold.
Either unlock/clear the threshold. 
On unlock the commands are sent to the device
On clear the commands are purged from the queue.

  'dmg', 'plist', 'mpkg', 'js', 'jse', 'ps1', 'ps1xml', 'psc1', 'psd1',
  'psm1', 'pssc', 'cdxml', 'vbs', 'vbe', 'wsf', 'wsc', 'msp', 'mst',
  'p12', 'pfx', 'p7b', 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'png', 'gif', 'bmp', 'p7m'
- No size restrictions

parameters. Not valid for apps implementing flexible assignment. Should use new version of api.
cannot be updated through this api.

parameters.description: Location group id also known as the organization group identifier (Required).

422.description: 1. {7100 : No sToken is uploaded at passed Lg.}2. {7101 : ClientContext is not valid for the current server.}3. {7102 : An active sync is already present on requested resource.}

put.summary: Resets the client context for the account at passed LG.
put.description: Client context contains info about the product that manages vpp account. This will reset the client context to let others able to claim the vpp account.

422.description: 1. {7100 : No sToken is uploaded at passed Lg.}

get.summary: Get the status and details for the VPP Sync Assets job at the given organization group
get.description: Vpp sync assets job will take time to sync applications on the apple server to the airwatch console. This will get the current status of the job.

parameters.name: locationGroupId

400.description: 1. {6 : Resource's organization group not found or user does not have access to this organization group.}

422.description: 1. {7100 : No sToken is uploaded at passed Lg.}

put.summary: Enables device-based assignment for the passed app.
put.description: Device-based VPP assignment allows you to distribute apps directly to a device without requiring an Apple ID. This will enable device-based assignment for the application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: Application id for which device based assignment needs to be enabled (Required).

422.description: 1. {7000 : Application not found or user does not have access to it.}2. {7103 : Device based assignment is already enabled for the app.}3. {7104 : This app is not eligible for device based assignment.}4. {7105 : This is not a valid vpp application.}

installed on devices having the application.

post.summary: Assigns a Smart Group to an Internal Application.
post.description: Assigns a Smart Group identified by the smart group Id to an internal application

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the application. (Required)

parameters.name: smartgroupid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the smart group. (Required)

400.description: 1.{6: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 2.{8: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 3.{19: Smart Group not found or User does not have access to it.} 4.{6: Cannot assign Smart Group to specified Application.} 5.{11: User does not have permission to perform this operation.} 6.{6: SmartGroup is already assigned to the Application Id} 7.{6: Duplicate smart groups cannot be passed.}

post.summary: Assigns a Smart Group to an Public Application.
post.description: Assigns a Smart Group identified by the smart group Id to a public application

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the application. (Required)

parameters.name: smartgroupid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the smart group. (Required)

400.description: 1.{6: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 2.{8: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 3.{19: Smart Group not found or User does not have access to it.} 4.{6: Cannot assign Smart Group to specified Application.} 5.{11: User does not have permission to perform this operation.} 6.{6: SmartGroup is already assigned to the Application Id} 7.{22: This application has different deployment policies configured for different assignment groups. This version of the API does not support this configuration. Please use AirWatch Console for this action.}

post.summary: Removes the Smart Group Assignment from an Internal Application.
post.description: Removes the Smart Group Assignment identified by the smart group Id from an Internal Application.

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the application. (Required)

parameters.name: smartgroupid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the smart group. (Required)

400.description: 1.{6: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 2.{8: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 3.{0: General Exception} 4.{11: User does not have permission to perform this operation.} 5.{19: Smart Group not found or User does not have access to it.} 6.{6: Resource's organization group not found or user does not have access to this organization group.} 7.{6: One or more passed smart groups are not assigned to the App.}

post.summary: Removes the Smart Group Assignment from a Public Application.
post.description: Removes the Smart Group Assignment identified by the smart group Id from a Public Application.

parameters.name: applicationid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the application. (Required)

parameters.name: smartgroupid
parameters.description: The Id integer of the smart group. (Required)

400.description: 1.{6: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 2.{8: Application not found or user does not have access to it.} 3.{0: General Exception} 4.{11: User does not have permission to perform this operation.} 5.{19: Smart Group not found or User does not have access to it.} 6.{6: Resource's organization group not found or user does not have access to this organization group.} 7.{6: One or more passed smart groups are not assigned to the App.} 8.{22: This application has different deployment policies configured for different assignment groups. This version of the API does not support this configuration. Please use AirWatch Console for this action.}

The groups responding to special attributes with this item

RegistryCriteriaApiModel.description: A model class for the registry criteria.

Path.description: The path of the key in the registry.

KeyName.description: The name of new key to be created in the registry.

KeyType.description: The type of key to be created in the registry. Supported values : String, Binary, DWord, QWord, MultiString, ExpandableString

KeyValue.description: The value of the key to be created in the registry.

DeploymentByCriteriaApiModel.description: A model class for the application deployment.

CriteriaType.description: Criteria type. Supported values: AppExists, AppDoesNotExist, FileExists, FileDoesNotExist, RegistryExists, RegistryDoesNotExist

LogicalCondition.description: Logical condition. Supported values : End, And, Or.

CustomScriptApiModel.description: Model class for the application uninstall process section applicable for .exe/.msi application(s).

CustomScriptType.description: The custom script type (Supported values: Input, Upload).

UninstallScriptBlobId.description:
Gets or sets the ID value of the uninstall script file uploaded on the console.
Supported file types : js,jse,ps1,ps1xml,psc1,psd1,psm1,pssc,cdxml,vbs,vbe,wsf,wsc

AppUnInstallProcessModel.description: Model class for the application uninstall process section applicable for .exe/.msi application(s).

UseCustomScript.description: Value indicating whether custom script is used or not.

DeploymentByCustomScriptApiModel.description: Model class for using custom script section applicable for .exe/.msi application(s).

CustomScriptFileBlodId.description:
The BlobId of the script file associated.
Supported file types : js, jse, ps1, ps1xml, psc1, psd1, psm1, pssc, cdxml, vbs, vbe, wsf, wsc

WhenToCallInstallCompleteApiModel.description: A model class for how to install options.

UseAdditionalCriteria.description: Value indicating whether additional criteria has to be used or not.

IdentifyApplicationBy.description: The way by which an application can be identified (Supported Values: DefiningCriteria, UsingCustomScript).

CriteriaList.description: The criteria configured to identify application.

CustomScript.description: The custom script configured to identify application.

AppUnInstallProcessModel.description: Model class for the application uninstall process section applicable for .exe/.msi application(s).

UseCustomScript.description: Value indicating whether custom script is used or not.

AppFilesOptionsModel.description: A model class for files options.

WhenToInstallApiModel.description: A model class for when to install options.

DiskSpaceRequiredInKb.description: The disk space required for installation of the package in KB.

DevicePowerRequired.description: The device power required for installation of the package. Valid range 0 - 100.

RamRequiredInMb.description: The RAM required for the installation of the page in MB.

HowToInstallApiModel.description: A model class for how to install options.

InstallContext.description: Install context (Supported values:  Device, User) where the package has to be installed.

InstallCommand.description: Gets or sets the install command to install a package using the command line ex: "/quiet".

AdminPrivileges.description: Value indicating whether admin privileges are needed for the installation of a package.

DeviceRestart.description: The device restart option. Supported values: DoNotRestart, ForceRestart, RestartIfNeeded

RetryCount.description: The number of times package installation operation will be retried.  Valid range 0 - 10

RetryIntervalInMinutes.description: The amount of time in minutes between retry operations.  Valid range 0 - 10

InstallTimeoutInMinutes.description: The amount of time in minutes that the installation process can run before the installer considers the installation may have failed.  Valid range 0 - 60

WhenToCallInstallCompleteApiModel.description: A model class for how to install options.

UseAdditionalCriteria.description: Value indicating whether additional criteria has to be used or not.

IdentifyApplicationBy.description: The way by which an application can be identified (Supported Values: DefiningCriteria, UsingCustomScript).

CriteriaList.description: The criteria configured to identify application.

CustomScript.description: The custom script configured to identify application.

AppDeploymentOptionsModel.description: A model class for deployment options.

WhenToCallInstallComplete.description: When to call install complete options.

CommandLineArguments.description: Command-line options to be used when calling MSIEXEC.exe.

InstallTimeoutInMinutes.description:
Amount of time, in minutes that the installation process can run before the installer 
considers the installation may have failed and no longer monitors the installation operation.Range 0-60

RetryCount.description: The number of times the download and installation operation will be retried before the installation will be marked as failed. With a limit of 10' attempts.

RetryIntervalInMinutes.description: Amount of time, in minutes between retry operations. Range 0-10

AppDeploymentOptionsModel.description: A model class for deployment options.

WhenToCallInstallComplete.description: When to call install complete options.

MacOsSoftwareDeploymentSummaryModel.description: Summary model for the macOs Software pacakge

IsManaged.description: Whether the installation type is managed or optional

InternalAppModel.description: This Model represents an Internal Application.

ApplicationName.description: Gets or sets the Application Name.

ActualFileVersion.description: Actual File Version of the App.

AssumeManagementOfUserInstalledApp.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether management of user installed apps should be assumed.

MinimumOperatingSystem.description: Minimum Operating System Version of the Application.

Sdk.description: Value indicating whether the application uses AirWatch Software Development Kit.

SdkProfileId.description: Sdk Profile Id of the App if it uses SDK Profile.

SdkProfileUuid.description: Sdk Profile Uuid of the App if it uses SDK Profile.

DevicesAssignedCount.description: Gets or sets the number of device to which current application is Assigned.

DevicesInstalledCount.description: Devices on which current application is Installed.

DevicesNotInstalledCount.description: Number of devices to which current application is Assigned, but not installed.

RenewalDate.description: Expiration date of the Device Provisioning Profile.

MsiDeploymentParamModel.description: Msi deployment param model. This is valid only for MSI files when Software Distribution is not enabled.

DeploymentOptions.description: Application deployment options for software distribution.
